README:
***********************************************
* PROGRAM FOR SIMULATION OF O(N) MODELS IN 3d *
***********************************************

** ACTION
***********************************************
The program on.cc is a program for the simulation of
O(N) model without external field on a 3d torus, 
whose hamiltonian is given by

H = - \sum_{<i,j>} \vec{S}_i*\vec{S}_j

where \vec{S}_j is a vector of norm 1 in the lattice
position j.


** CHOICE OF N
***********************************************
The choice of N happens at configuration time 
through the macro Nval.

As an example to simulate O(4) model  the
program has to be configured through
./configure Nval=4

The degenerate case Nval=1 corresponds to the Ising model.
Clearly the program is not optimized for the Ising but
it works.

For compilers lacking of inter-procedural optimization
it is usually convenient to use also 
--enable-one-file-compilation 
in order to compile just a single big file.

After the configuration, the compilation is performed as
usual by
make


**KNOWN ISSUES
********************************************************

On some systems, configure fails while checking for 
the presence of the SIMD extensions, i.e. in one of
the following lines

checking for x86 cpuid 0x00000001 output... 20655:1100800:29ae3ff:bfebfbff
checking whether mmx is supported... yes
checking whether sse is supported... yes
checking whether sse2 is supported... yes
checking whether sse3 is supported... yes
checking whether ssse3 is supported... yes
checking whether sse4.1 is supported... yes
checking whether sse4.2 is supported... yes
checking whether avx is supported... no

if this happens use the configuration flag
--disable-simd-check


** INPUT PARAMETERS
********************************************************

An example of input file is give by ./src/input.in. The format 
of this file is

name_of_the_variable  value_of_the_variable  possible_comments(up to carriage return)

The variables are:

latox, latoy, latoz: the sizes of the torus

beta: the inverse temperature

campione: the number of updates to be performed

update: if =0 the Metropolis update is used, if =1 the heatbath and
	if =2 the single cluster Wolff update

measevery: number of updates to be performed between measurements

over: the number of overrelaxation sweeps to be performed after every 
      Metropolis/heatbath/Wolff sweep

dist_for_corr: distance between the operators for correlator measurements
      when defects are present

inizio: if =0 the starting configuration is an ordered one, if =1 is the
	random configuration and if =2 is the configuration saved in the 
	file conf_file (see later)

saveconf: if !=0 save the last configuration in the file conf_file (see later)

conf_file: name of the configuration file

data_file: name of the data file

err_file: name of the error file

randseed: seed for the random number generator. If =0 machine time is used.


** OUTPUT 
********************************************************
The first line of the output data_file is 

latox latoy latoz beta

the following columns are

1) energy     
2) magnetization   
3) FT of the 2 point function at the smallest momentum
4) aux1 (first term of eq. 14 of arXiv:0810.2716)
5) aux2 (second term of eq. 14 of arXiv:0810.2716)

aux1-aux2=helicity modulus

some analysis programs are in ./src/Analisi
description: C++ program for simulation of O(N) 3d models
